name: Compass
summary: Building the shared coordination infrastructure — charter, archetypes, registry, and web viewer — for the Henkaku Center ecosystem.
project_goals: Define shared charter and governance framework
Design registry archetypes for 10 entry types
Build web viewer for coordination documents

name: SDS Launch
summary: Launching the Graduate School of Design & Science with antidisciplinary project-based curriculum, opening April 2026.
project_goals: Enroll first cohort of Master's and PhD students
completion_criterion: First cohort enrolled and classes begin April 2026.

name: Antidisciplinary Charter
summary: Drafting and ratifying the shared governance charter that articulates foundational values, principles, and operational commitments across the Henkaku Center, SDS, and Chiba Tech.
problem_statement: Three closely coupled institutions need a shared normative framework — not a legal contract, but a living document that articulates values, governance, and coordination principles so that participants can align without rigid hierarchy.
project_goals: Articulate foundational orientations and balancing dichotomies
Establish registry and coordination infrastructure mandates
Achieve ratification by founding faculty consensus
completion_criterion: Charter ratified by consensus of the Director of the Henkaku Center and seven founding faculty members of SDS.
success_criteria: Charter adopted as the normative governance document guiding research, education, and coordination across all three institutions.
